main
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      main.Game

public class Game
extends java.util.Observable

The Game class drives the Quoridor game logic. It extends java.util.Observable and acts as a subject for the GameBoard class, which observes/subscribes to a Game object.

Author:
Eli Donahue

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game(int numPlayers,
            int numWalls)
Constructs a Game object with an array of initialized players and a Board object.

Parameters:
numPlayers - the number of players in this Game
numWalls - the maximum number of walls to divide among Players
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method constructs and starts a Game based on optional command line arguments. Arguments may be (int numberOfPlayers) or (int numberOfPlayers, String fileName).

Parameters:
args - (optional) (int numberOfPlayers) or (int numberOfPlayers, String fileName)

startGame

public void startGame()
Starts the game by adding a GameBoard (UI) to this Game.

playGame

public void playGame(Parser p)
Loops through the Players' turns until someone wins. Gets the move, translates the move, plays the move, and then updates the UI.

Parameters:
p - the Parser to parse Players' turns

playGame

public void playGame(Parser p,
                     java.lang.String fileName)
Loops through a file of Players' turns until someone wins. Gets the move, translates the move, plays the move, and then updates the UI.

Parameters:
p - the Parser to parse Players' turns
fileName - the name of the file to scan for moves

updatePlayer

public void updatePlayer(Player p)
Resets Player's moves and retrieves current available moves.

Parameters:
p - Player

playTurn

public boolean playTurn(java.lang.String s)
Parse and play the turn.

Parameters:
s - a String containing a Player's move in [a-i][1-9] or [a-i][1-9][vh] format
Returns:
a boolean based on the success of playing the turn

checkForWin

public boolean checkForWin()
Checks to see if the current Player has made it into its "win area." Sets Game.gameWon to true if the Player won.

Returns:
a boolean telling whether or not this Player has won

nextTurn

public void nextTurn()
Increments the current player to begin the next Player's turn.

notifyObservers

public void notifyObservers(java.util.Observable observable,
                            Board board)
Notifies Observer (the UI) of changes to the Game.

Parameters:
observable - an Observable object (this Game)
board - this Game's Board

new4PlayerGame

public void new4PlayerGame()
Disposes of the previous GameBoard (UI) and creates a new Game.

new2PlayerGame

public void new2PlayerGame()
Disposes of the previous GameBoard (UI) and creates a new Game.

quit

public void quit()
Exits the program with exit code 0.

getObservers

public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Observer> getObservers()
Gets an ArrayList of this Game's Observers. We only ever use the first one.

Returns:
the list of observers for this game (the UI)

getBoard

public Board getBoard()
Gets the Board from this Game.

Returns:
a Board object

currPlayer

public Player currPlayer()
Gets the current Player.

Returns:
the Player currently taking its turn

getNumPlayers

public int getNumPlayers()
Gets the number of Players in this Game.

Returns:
an integer number of Players

gameWon

public boolean gameWon()
Gets this Game's gameWon boolean.

Returns:
a boolean telling whether or not this Game has been won

setObservers

public void setObservers(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Observer> observers)
Sets an ArrayList of Observers as this Game's UI.

Parameters:
observers - an ArrayList of Observers (one GameBoard)

registerObserver

public void registerObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
Adds an Observer (GameBoard) to this Game's Observers.

Parameters:
observer - a GameBoard object

removeObserver

public void removeObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
Removes an Observer from this Game's Observers

Parameters:
observer - a GameBoard object
